Housing.Description: Discover how to build primitive structures out of wood, keeping your people a little bit safer from the elements and animals.

Water Collection.Description: Start collection water straight from its source, rather than just drinking it from a stream, decreasing the risks of disease from waterborne pathogens.

Tribal Society I.Description: Encourage a closer-knit societal structure between your tribesmen, allowing the better collections of resources within your lands.

Improved Resource Preservation.Description: Improve your tribe's ways of storing resources, allowing for more food to be both collected and stored in your buildings.

Improved Water Collection.Description: Discover new techniques of carrying water, such as the waterskin, which make your citizens even safer from waterborne pathogens.

Clothing.Description: Learn how to make very primitive clothing, upping the chance of your tribesmen surviving the winter months.

Improved Housing I.Description: Improve your housing methods, allowing your great people to flourish even further.

Improved Resource Storage I.Description: Discover the benefits of below-ground storage, allowing you to keep food and other materials dry and preserved for when your tribe needs them.

Primitive Mineral Gathering.Description: Learn of versatile special rocks inlaid in the stone your tribe mines, and begin extracting them.

Primitive Tools.Description: A particularly smart tribe member discovered that properly binding your tools and improving them with ore can increase the tool's lifespan.

Improved Insulation.Description: Discover the properties of dried vegetation, which allows your tribesmen to build houses that can keep them warm during the winter time.

Improved Resource Storage II.Description: Discover easier and more efficent ways of refrigeration and animal protection, allowing your to keep more resources at any one time.

Improved Tools I.Description: Discover how to melt down the ore a bit, making it both easier to work with and a bit stronger.

Tribal Society II.Description: Due to the decreasing demand for constant work and the improving economic situation of the tribe, your tribesmen form closer bonds.

Weapons.Description: Discover the virtures of the spear, allowing fending off wild animals to become easier.

The Sling.Description: While pondering life one morning, a tribe member discovered elasticity, which allowed him to craft the first sling, greatly improving the tribe's safety and resource gathering prowess.

Hunting.Description: Improve food gathering techniques enough to consider it 'hunting'. Your tribesmen also now travel in groups when going on a hunt, increase the likelihood of them returning alive.

Improved Hunting Techniques.Description: Further improve hunting techniques, allowing more food to be brought back per hunt.

Stronger Sling.Description: Strengthen the sling, allowing the projectiles within to be flung faster and farther than ever before.

Improved Housing II.Description: Discover how to use a primitive version of pitch on the roofs of your tribe's houses, strengthening them and allowing more people to safely fit in a house.

Improved Tools II.Description: Learn how to better melt ore, allowing your tribe's tools to outpreform any others in the land.

Tribal Society III.Description: The more the economical climate stabilizes in your tribe, the more your tribesmen form friendships, which have allowed you to overall improve the quality of your civilization.

Agriculture.Description: Discover the miracle of farming and cultivating, sending the need for hunters dramatically down. Your civilization is no longer tribal in nature, and can now establish yourself in the area.
